function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Global nature of pandemics requires action at local levels","Impact":"Inadequate local action can lead to uncontrolled spread of diseases within communities","Mitigation":"Establishing effective communication channels and community engagement at the local level","Technologies":"Social media, urban informatics, data analytics","People":"Local community members, stakeholders in public health","Owner":"Local government, public health authorities"},{"Description":"Maximizing mobility at street level through urban informatics and data","Impact":"Failure to optimize street-level mobility can lead to overcrowding and increased risk of disease transmission","Mitigation":"Implementation of smart urban planning and mobility solutions to promote 'soft' or slow mobility options","Technologies":"Urban informatics, data analytics, mobility tracking systems","People":"City planners, urban designers, public health authorities","Owner":"Local government, urban development agencies"},{"Description":"Lack of adaptation for remote working and lockdowns in some countries","Impact":"Inability to adapt to remote working and lockdowns can hinder response to pandemics and increase economic and social disruption","Mitigation":"Investing in infrastructure for remote work, providing training and support for remote workers, and promoting flexibility in work arrangements","Technologies":"Telecommuting tools, digital collaboration platforms, remote access technologies","People":"Employers, government, workers","Owner":"Employers, government"}]}
